result.execSummary:
The defendant Larry A Gerger was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Violate/Harassment Restraining Order, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 813.125(7).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Larry A Gerger

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Larry A Gerger in court with attorney Wright C. Laufenberg.  Kurt Byron Zengler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Cases called appearances given.  Deft enters a plea of no contest to Count 1 in both cases.  Count 2 in 15CM181 is DRI.   Plea questionnaire reviewed. Clerk directed to enter plea. Factual basis. Court accepts pleas & finds guilty.

Court orders a $100 fine + costs for Count 1 in 15CM181 and 15CM122.  60 dtp or setup a payment plan.

no contact w/Stacy Hansen/Gerger in person, by phone or any electronic means and no contact with any residence she would reside at.  Deft to post $195.00 on or before Oct 30, 2015 at 3:00 pm and $305.00 on or before November 3, 2015 at 3:00 pm. if not paid to report back to the jail.  Curfew from 6:00 pm until 8:00 am to be at his residence.
